connectivityPlugins.description: An array of connectivity plugins for the correlator to start.

additionalProperties.$comment: Both schemas contain class. If class is the first specified property then VSC will attenmpt to validate to the first schema in the array below

dynamicChainManagers.description: A map where each key is a manager name, that is, a string naming an instance of a dynamic chain manager plug-in class.

transport.description: Specifies the transport plug-in associated with this dynamic chain manager.

managerConfig.description: Specifies the configuration map that will be passed to the chain manager constructor when it is created at startup. The available configuration options are defined by the plug-in author, therefore, see the plug-in's documentation for details.

port.description: The user-defined port on which the server is accessible.

bindAddress.description: Binds to specific interfaces, potentially on multiple ports. Each entry is either a host, or a host:port combination.
bindAddress.$comment: We could add a pattern to match.

tls.description: Set this to true to enable TLS (https).

tlsCertificateFile.description: The server certificate file in PEM format. Required if TLS is enabled.

tlsKeyFile.description: The private key for the certificate in PEM format. Required if TLS is enabled.

connectionTimeoutSecs.description: Maximum time to handle a single request before returning a timeout (in seconds).

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of simultaneous connections which can be handled.

libraryName.description: The base filename name of the library, excluding the operating system-specific prefixes and suffixes (that is, excluding the "lib" prefix and ".so" suffix for UNIX, and the ".dll" suffix for Windows).

class.description: The base name of the class, without a package. The plug-in's documentation specifies the class name to be used.

directory.description: Specifies a directory where where the library will be found.

class.description: The name of the plug-in class, which must include the package. The plug-in's documentation specifies the class name to be used.

directory.description: Specifies a directory where the jar files will be found (unless an absolute path is specified for a classpath element).
